task.title: Test on the Production Host Groups
task.shortdesc: Even a small inconsistency in your environments (such as an unmatched style sheet) can make your offers appear differently on Production than on Development or Staging.

context.p: Suggested best practices are listed below. However, you should follow your company Quality Assurance procedures.

step.cmd: Set-up an exclusive campaign level target condition that only you and your QA team can meet.

stepresult.p: Example parameter: testing=true. This ensures no visitors will see the campaign until you remove the target condition. Be very cautious. Do not risk showing new unvalidated campaign content to your visitors.

step.cmd: If you have not already done so, move the campaign content, including mbox.js and all pages with mboxes to the Production server.
Approve the campaign so you can view it.

p.note: Do not do this until you have set up the exclusive campaign target rule above.

step.cmd: Confirm that all offers and experiences look and behave correctly.

stepresult.p: View the campaign with the exclusive target condition. Browse through success metrics and click-through the conversion activity. Confirm target conditions and passing of values work. Review report data.
